conclusion: To determine the acceleration of the particle during the time interval from 1 to 3 seconds, we need to analyze the given velocity-time (v-t) graph.
We are interested in the time interval from t = 1 second to t = 3 seconds. In this interval, the velocity decreases linearly from 2 m/s to -2 m/s.
At t = 1 second, the velocity v1 = 2 m/s.
At t = 3 seconds, the velocity v2 = -2 m/s.
The change in velocity is Δv = v2 - v1 = -2 m/s - 2 m/s = -4 m/s.
The time interval is from t = 1 second to t = 3 seconds.
The change in time is Δt = 3 s - 1 s = 2 s.
Acceleration is defined as the change in velocity divided by the change in time: a = Δv/Δt = -4 m/s / 2 s = -2 m/s².
